references.paper_title: Weak convergence and the general theory of processes
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of extended weak convergence, which is central to the methodology of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Adapted Wasserstein distances and stability in mathematical finance
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical background on adapted weak topologies, which are relevant to the current paper's focus on extended weak convergence.

references.paper_title: Adapted topologies and higher rank signatures
references.reason: This paper establishes connections between adapted topologies and higher rank signatures, contributing to the theoretical framework of the current work.

references.paper_title: Characteristic functions of measures on geometric rough paths
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational theory of path characteristic functions which is directly used in the current paper for measuring distances between stochastic processes.

references.paper_title: PCF-GAN: generating sequential data via the characteristic function of measures on the path space
references.reason: This paper introduces the PCF-GAN model, which serves as a direct precursor and inspiration for the HRPCF-GAN model proposed in this work.
